private_information: I am a mobile vehicle and can drive between places
I cannot lift crates by myself; loading/unloading requires a hoist
truck0.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

private_information: I am a mobile vehicle and can drive between places
I cannot lift crates by myself; loading/unloading requires a hoist
truck1.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist0.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist1.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist2.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist3.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist4.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

hoist5.goal: Coordinate to achieve global goal: crate0 on crate4; crate3 on pallet0; crate2 on pallet3; crate4 on pallet5.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that model the multi-agent trucks-and-hoists transportation/rearrangement task and respect all agent constraints and numeric fuel-cost objective.

public_information: Trucks can drive between places; driving increases fuel-cost by 10
Hoists operate only at their current place and can lift/put/load/unload crates; hoist lift/unload operations increase fuel-cost by 1
A surface can be a pallet or a crate; crates are both movable objects and surfaces that can support other crates
A surface is clear if nothing is on it
Capacity constraint for loading a crate into a truck: current_load(truck) + weight(crate) <= load_limit(truck)

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action. Include numeric fluents for fuel-cost, truck loads, and crate weights. Ensure capacity constraints are enforced. Model hoist availability and clear surfaces, and model crates as surfaces that can be stacked. Use the initial state {environment->init} and the goal {environment->goal}. Respect the private constraints of agents: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}. Do not assume information beyond what is given. Produce only the PDDL domain and problem files as specified.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoists' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
